com.qualcomm.ftcrobotcontroller.opmodes

Class PushBotManualSensors

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode.OpMode
      • com.qualcomm.ftcrobotcontroller.opmodes.PushBotHardware
        • com.qualcomm.ftcrobotcontroller.opmodes.PushBotTelemetry
          • com.qualcomm.ftcrobotcontroller.opmodes.PushBotHardwareSensors
            • com.qualcomm.ftcrobotcontroller.opmodes.PushBotTelemetrySensors
              • com.qualcomm.ftcrobotcontroller.opmodes.PushBotManualSensors

  • public class PushBotManualSensors
extends PushBotTelemetrySensors
    Provide a basic manual operational mode that uses the left and right drive motors, left arm motor, servo motors and gamepad input from two gamepads for the Push Bot. This manual op-mode use the touch sensors and gamepad controls to drive the arm to a predefined position (i.e. the location of the touch sensor).

    • Method Detail

      • loop

        public void loop()
        Implement a state machine that controls the robot during manual-operation. The state machine uses gamepad and sensor input to transition between states. The system calls this member repeatedly while the OpMode is running.
        Overrides:
        loop in class PushBotHardware
